headline: London police arrest hundreds for backing banned pro-Palestine group
subhead: The group Palestine Action was banned in the UK after activists broke into a British air force base in June to protest British military support for Israel’s war with Hamas.

headline: Trump's tariffs and strong euro act as double whammy for European companies
subhead: While the depreciation of the dollar may suggest a more important global role for the single currency, it is currently having a negative impact on the competitiveness of companies in the eurozone.

headline: Iceland's Eyjafjallajökull volcano is being overrun by Instagrammers
subhead: 'Of Volcanoes and Men' (4/6). Made famous by its spectacular 2010 eruption, Eyjafjallajökull in Iceland has since attracted waves of tourists armed with their smartphones. Finnish photographer Juuso Westerlund followed in the footsteps of these crowds, who have transformed a rugged, wild landscape into an Instagram backdrop.

headline: Ayn Rand's irresistible attraction to the dominance of the 'alpha male,' as embodied by Elon Musk
subhead: 'Musk Fictions' (6/6). Since 2024 and his opportunistic support for Donald Trump, American billionaire Elon Musk has increasingly cited the 20th-century novelist Ayn Rand, the apostle of rational selfishness and capitalism.

headline: Maryam, Afghan chef: 'Leaving Afghanistan brought a whirlwind of emotions, not knowing who you are anymore'
subhead: 'Refugee Recipes' (5/6). Maryam left Afghanistan at the age of 13, crossing 11 countries to reach France. Along the way, in Turkey, she discovered kumpir – a stuffed baked potato – which has since become her lucky dish.
